locations.name: Harrow's Hollow General Store
locations.description: A sturdy timber-and-stone building at the town's heart, the general store is the main source of goods for Harrow's Hollow, catering to both locals and frontiersfolk. Shelves brim with practical supplies such as rope, grain sacks, lanterns, and tools. The air carries the mingled scents of oiled leather and dried herbs. Dimly lit by lantern light, the shop holds a quiet ambiance with soft shuffling sounds from the back storeroom. The atmosphere is one of cautious hope as villagers rebuild after a recent curse.

npcs.name: Old Marna
npcs.description: A wiry, sharp-eyed woman who runs the general store. Practical and straightforward, she monitors village affairs with a mixture of suspicion and cautious friendliness. She offers minor tasks to willing helpers and emphasizes the importance of purposeful travel beyond the palisade.
npcs.attitude: Cautious but helpful, encouraging trust-building and cooperation.

lootTable: Adventurer's pack (1 gp)
Lantern, hooded (5 gp)
10 days' rations (5 sp per)
Cured leather pouch (8 sp)
Handwritten map of local trails (contains a clue about a haunted ruin)
Old bronze key marked with a faded raven sigil
plotHooks: Old Marna offers a labor task to restock the storeroom by fetching a crate from the Wyrd Lantern Inn's cellar through Cira.
Old Marna requests help clearing a rat infestation in the store's back storeroom and hints at valuables hidden among crates bearing noble crests.
Old Marna emphasizes the need for purposeful travel beyond the palisade and offers assistance with access to the side door.
Elder Mirna organizes official quests in the Town Square related to village recovery.
Hints of unclaimed rewards for those who helped lift the recent curse.
The village is rebuilding and regaining trust among its people.
locations.dmInstructions: Use Old Marna as the proprietor who can provide minor tasks such as fetching supplies and clearing infestations. Emphasize the importance of purposeful travel and villagers' trust during the village's recovery. She cooperates with the party regarding side door access for quest progression. Direct players to Elder Mirna in the Town Square for main quests. Keep the back storeroom atmospheric with sounds of movement but no traps detected.

doors.name: Front Door
doors.description: A broad, reinforced oak door with brass fittings and a bell overhead.

doors.name: Back Storeroom Door
doors.description: A smaller, iron-banded door leading to the cramped storeroom, locked but accessible with the Old bronze key.

doors.name: Eastern Side Door
doors.description: A sturdy side door marked for watchmen and deliveries, leading toward the East Gate beyond the palisade. Access is controlled by Old Marna and requires purposeful travel beyond the village boundary.

dcChecks: Insight DC 12: Understand that Old Marna values the rebuilding efforts and the trust of the villagers.
Investigation DC 14: Notice the well-used supplies and crates indicating ongoing restocking and recovery.
Perception DC 13: Detect signs of a rat infestation in the back storeroom.
Persuasion DC 15: Convince Old Marna to grant access to the eastern side door for purposeful travel.
locations.accessibility: Easily accessible from the main square, with wide doorways and step-free entry. Side door access requires authorization from Old Marna.

features.name: Notice Board
features.description: A cluttered board filled with handwritten notices about village recovery, missing pets, and calls for aid.

features.name: Counter and Ledger
features.description: A sturdy wooden counter with a thick ledger book, used for tracking trades and local labor tasks.

features.name: Back Storeroom
features.description: A cramped room packed with crates and burlap sacks, some bearing noble crests. A recent rat infestation affects this area, and some crates may contain hidden valuables.

features.name: Eastern Side Door
features.description: A reinforced side door leading to the palisade and East Gate. Controlled access granted only for purposeful travel beyond the village.

encounters.summary: The party enters the general store in the early morning and meets Old Marna, the store's proprietor. She offers a simple labor task to help restock the storeroom and advises the party to seek out Elder Mirna in the Town Square for main quest assignments.
encounters.impact: Introduced Old Marna as the NPC proprietor, established the availability of minor quest tasks, and directed the party toward Elder Mirna for further quests. Set the tone for village recovery and trust-building.

encounters.summary: The party returned to the general store, engaged with Old Marna who greeted them with suspicion and cautious friendliness, and accepted a side quest involving retrieving a supply crate from the Wyrd Lantern Inn's cellar by speaking with Cira, as well as clearing a rat infestation in the store's back storeroom. The party informed Marna of their plan to investigate a side quest involving a trinket beneath the knight's statue in the Town Square. Marna permitted the detour and offered assistance with access to the eastern side door leading to the palisade and East Gate.
encounters.impact: Established active quest progression through Old Marna, confirmed her cooperation for access to the side door, and added new tasks involving the Wyrd Lantern Inn and store storeroom. The general store environment remains intact with no traps detected.

locations.adventureSummary: Upon entering Harrow's Hollow General Store from the Town Square, the party encountered Old Marna, who greeted them with a mixture of suspicion and cautious friendliness as she busied herself tallying supplies by lantern light. Noticing their interest in the eastern side door marked for watchmen and deliveries, Marna acknowledged their intent to proceed toward the East Gate and offered assistance in gaining access, emphasizing the need for purposeful travel beyond the palisade. When the party accepted a side quest to aid Marna, she assigned two tasks: retrieve a supply crate from The Wyrd Lantern Inn's cellar by speaking with Cira and clear a rat infestation in the store's back storeroom, also hinting at possible valuables hidden among crates bearing noble crests. The quest was formally logged with clear objectives, and Marna updated the village log to prevent interference during the work. Before commencing these tasks, the party informed Marna of their plan to investigate a side quest involving a trinket hidden beneath the knight's statue in the Town Square. Marna responded with a knowing smile, permitting the brief detour. Throughout these interactions, the General Store remained dimly lit and filled with the quiet ambiance of a small village's daily commerce, with no traps detected. The party prepared to request the key or assistance from Marna to access the side door leading to the palisade and East Gate, intending to confirm her cooperation, test area transitions, and ensure quest progression without encountering loading or pathfinding issues before moving forward.

locations.name: Harrow's Hollow Town Square
locations.description: The communal heart of the village, this open cobblestone square is ringed by lantern posts, benches, and the faded statue of a forgotten knight. On market days, stalls crowd the space, but even now, locals gossip in small clusters, eyes wary of newcomers. The villagers wear anxious expressions as they prepare for the incoming supply caravan. Elder Mirna has entrusted the party with guarding the caravan's arrival at the East Gate at noon. Despite the bustling activity, the East Gate is not directly accessible from the Town Square; only the General Store lies adjacent. Villagers and militia volunteers advise patience or aid with local tasks until the route to the gate is restored. The atmosphere is tense but without immediate threats.

npcs.name: Old Tommen
npcs.description: A weathered, hunched herdsman with wild hair and a nervous gaze. Tommen is known for spreading superstitions and warning of restless spirits in the woods. He shared a side quest about a ghostly shade near the moor and mentioned a mysterious trinket beneath the statue of the forgotten knight.
npcs.attitude: Suspicious of strangers, eager to share tales of doom, but grateful for kind words and a listening ear.

npcs.name: Elder Mirna
npcs.description: The village elder who entrusted the party with the critical quest of guarding the supply caravan arriving at the East Gate. She is wise and deeply concerned about the village's recovery and safety.
npcs.attitude: Serious and focused, respectful towards the party, supportive but anxious about upcoming events.

npcs.name: Militia Watch
npcs.description: Volunteers from the village militia tasked with protecting the Town Square and coordinating defense. They warned the party of dangers near the East Gate, including bandits and wild dogs, and gave directions through the General Store's back lane.
npcs.attitude: Alert and cautious, cooperative with the party, eager to ensure safety.

lootTable: Dropped pouch of 7 sp (hidden beneath a bench)
Wooden whistle carved in the shape of a raven
Small tin amulet of protection (nonmagical, but rumored to ward off evil)
plotHooks: Old Tommen corners the party to warn them about 'the shade on the moor,' referencing recent spectral sightings.
A traveling merchant seeks help recovering goods lost to bandits north of town.
Children whisper about a secret under the statue--a lost trinket or something darker.
Assist Elder Mirna in preparing for the supply caravan's arrival and guarding the East Gate.
Help militia volunteers with local tasks while awaiting the reopening of the route to the East Gate.
locations.dmInstructions: Use Tommen's superstitious ramblings for early foreshadowing. A DC 11 Persuasion check gets him to share legends about the keep and the cursed knight. If players search the statue (DC 13 Investigation), they find a hidden compartment holding a rusty locket (worth 2 gp, sentimental value to some locals). Highlight the blocked passage to the East Gate and encourage interaction with the militia and Elder Mirna for side quests.
dcChecks: Investigation DC 13: Discover a hidden compartment in the statue.
Persuasion DC 11: Convince Tommen to reveal a local legend about ghostly lights or the keep's curse.
locations.accessibility: Fully open and central, all major buildings and streets lead here; accessible to all. Passage to the East Gate is currently blocked and must be accessed via the General Store's back lane.

features.name: Knight's Statue
features.description: A weathered stone monument, its inscription nearly worn away, depicting a forgotten hero with a drawn sword. Beneath it lies a hidden compartment discovered by the party.

features.name: Lantern Posts
features.description: Iron lanterns burn through most nights, keeping superstitious villagers at ease.

features.name: Market Stalls
features.description: Colorful canvas stalls, currently empty save for a few crates and benches.

encounters.summary: Elder Mirna entrusts the party with guarding the incoming supply caravan at the East Gate and explains the village's dependence on safe trade. The party learns the East Gate is not directly accessible from the Town Square, only via the General Store, which blocks immediate progression.
encounters.impact: Main quest logged and marked. Party advised to assist with local tasks or wait until route restoration. Side quests introduced by Old Tommen and militia watch. Party prepares to transition to the General Store to access the back lane to the East Gate.

locations.adventureSummary: Elder Mirna assigned the party to guard the supply caravan arriving at the East Gate at noon. The East Gate is unreachable directly from the Town Square; only the General Store is adjacent. Attempts to proceed were blocked due to missing area data. The party spoke with militia volunteers and Old Tommen, who shared side quests about a restless shade on the moor and a trinket beneath the knight's statue. The party resolved to enter the General Store next to seek the back passage to the East Gate and prepare for the caravan's arrival.

locations.name: East Gate and Guardhouse
locations.description: The East Gate stands open, flanked by a well-kept stone guardhouse with wooden roofing and ready lanterns. The towering palisade of Harrow's Hollow looms above, guarding the muddy road that leads eastward along the Witchlight Trail. The atmosphere is one of cautious optimism as villagers resume their daily routines and sentries maintain vigilant yet hopeful watch over the gate. Elder Mirna and several villagers offer quiet congratulations to the party, acknowledging their heroic efforts in lifting the village's curse. The area is free of traps and threats, allowing smooth passage as the party prepares to undertake local quests.

npcs.name: Joran
npcs.description: A broad-shouldered militia watchman, armed with a spear, friendly and knowledgeable about local happenings. He conveys gratitude from Elder Mirna and offers assistance to travelers.
npcs.attitude: Welcoming and cautiously hopeful after recent troubles.

npcs.name: Old Marna
npcs.description: An elder villager who holds the key to the side door granting access to the palisade and East Gate. She is cooperative and supportive of the party's efforts.

npcs.name: Elder Mirna
npcs.description: The village elder who acknowledges the party's success in lifting the curse and offers quiet congratulations along with hints of material and social rewards.

npcs.name: Cira
npcs.description: The innkeeper of The Wyrd Lantern Inn, whose cooperation is essential for the party's supply retrieval mission.

lootTable: Town gate key (now held by Old Marna)
Guard's whistle
Small pouch with 12 cp
Town patrol schedule (handwritten, with notes about recent disturbances near the keep)
plotHooks: Assist Old Marna by restocking the General Store and clearing the rat infestation.
Retrieve supply crate from The Wyrd Lantern Inn's cellar with Cira's cooperation.
Await the arrival of the merchant wagon mentioned by Joran.
Assist villagers in rebuilding security and prosperity after the curse lifts.
Venture beyond the gate to explore the Witchlight Trail and the wilderness beyond.
Seek out Elder Mirna in the town square for recognition and further quests.
locations.dmInstructions: Joran serves as a friendly militia watchman who can provide information on local events and the state of affairs. Old Marna holds the key to the palisade's side door and can grant access. Elder Mirna and Cira are additional NPCs to interact with for social and quest-related purposes. There are no traps or threats in the immediate area. The atmosphere reflects the village's recovery, encouraging interactions that emphasize hope and cautious optimism. The party can prepare here before proceeding to other local quest objectives.

doors.name: Main Gate
doors.description: Double heavy wooden gates, open now, iron-banded and weathered but sturdy.

doors.name: Guardhouse Door
doors.description: A narrow, iron-banded door set into the stone guardhouse, unlocked for party access.

doors.name: Side Door to Palisade
doors.description: A wooden side door in the palisade, recently unlocked with Old Marna's key to grant party passage.

dcChecks: Investigation DC 14: Discover faint footprints and broken brush leading toward the haunted keep.
Persuasion DC 13: Convince militia to share information or allow after-hours travel.
locations.accessibility: Accessible via a side lane and main road; guarded but welcoming during daylight hours.

features.name: Watch Bell
features.description: A large bronze bell used to sound alarms; can be heard across town.

features.name: Patrol Roster
features.description: A chalkboard inside the guardhouse listing names and shifts, with Elen's name circled in chalk.

features.name: Gate Mechanism
features.description: A stout bar and iron lock securing the gates, currently disengaged as the gate stands open.

encounters.summary: The party meets Joran and Old Marna at the East Gate and Guardhouse, gaining information about local conditions and receiving permission to pass through the side door.
encounters.impact: The gate is open and accessible, the party has the key to the side door, and local militia shows cautious optimism reflecting the village's recovery.

encounters.summary: The party returns to the East Gate and Guardhouse, greeted with congratulations from Elder Mirna and other villagers for lifting the village's curse. They prepare to assist Old Marna by restocking the General Store and clearing a rat infestation, coordinating with innkeeper Cira for supply retrieval.
encounters.impact: The party's reputation is enhanced, no new threats exist at the gate, and quest objectives are clarified toward local assistance and supply recovery.

locations.adventureSummary: Upon arriving at the East Gate and Guardhouse on 1492 Ches 1, 13:34:00, the party was welcomed with cautious optimism after lifting the village's curse. Elder Mirna and villagers offered congratulations and hints of rewards. The gate remains open and free of traps or threats. The party resolved to assist Old Marna by restocking the General Store and clearing a rat infestation, with plans to retrieve supplies from The Wyrd Lantern Inn's cellar through cooperation with innkeeper Cira. The atmosphere remains hopeful as the party sets out toward these objectives.

locations.name: Militia Barracks
locations.description: A utilitarian, two-story stone building with a small training yard. The barracks houses Harrow's militia--peasant guards, hunters, and retired soldiers. Inside, bunks are neatly arranged, and a wall bears faded banners from better days.

npcs.name: Ranger Branik
npcs.description: A grizzled, sharp-eyed scout recently returned from patrolling the wilds. Branik is laconic and slow to trust, but fiercely protective of the town.
npcs.attitude: Wary of strangers, but quick to aid those who prove themselves. Respects martial skill.

lootTable: Militia uniform (common clothing)
Shortbow and 10 arrows
Simple iron dagger
Coiled rope (30 ft)
Map of local wilds annotated with hunting blinds and secret trails
plotHooks: Ranger Branik asks the party to help track a strange beast seen near the keep.
A militia member mentions hearing unearthly howls from the woods at night.
A battered shield bears a crest matching that on the general store's bronze key.
locations.dmInstructions: Branik can teach basic survival skills or offer to guide the party to the keep for a price. A DC 12 Survival check reveals his annotated maps contain hidden routes to bypass obvious dangers.

doors.name: Barracks Main Door
doors.description: A stout, iron-bound wooden door with scrape marks from years of use.

doors.name: Armory Door
doors.description: A reinforced wooden door with a heavy padlock, leading to the militia's armory.

dcChecks: Survival DC 12: Learn about hidden paths and dangers in the wilds.
Investigation DC 13: Find a battered shield with a mysterious crest.
locations.accessibility: Located on a side street, accessible by road; entry is monitored by militia.

features.name: Training Yard
features.description: A small, open area with straw dummies and simple wooden fencing.

features.name: Banner Wall
features.description: A display of tattered banners and crests of old lords who once protected the vale.

features.name: Armory
features.description: A locked room containing spare weapons and gear for the militia.

locations.name: The Wyrd Lantern Inn
locations.description: A cozy, low-ceilinged inn with mismatched furniture, a roaring hearth, and walls festooned with charms against evil. The aroma of stew and fresh bread fills the air. Laughter and song are frequent, but at night, whispers of fear and superstition drift between tables.

npcs.name: Cira the Innkeeper
npcs.description: A warm, quick-witted woman with a knack for remembering faces and secrets. She runs the Wyrd Lantern with a firm but friendly hand.
npcs.attitude: Welcoming to all, but especially those with coin or gossip. Protective of her staff and regulars.

lootTable: Free meal and ale (at Cira's discretion)
Set of bone dice (left in a booth)
Silver earring (lost under a table)
Charm against the evil eye (hanging near the bar)
plotHooks: A fearful regular claims to have seen a ghostly figure on the east road.
Cira offers the party free rooms if they can calm frightened townsfolk.
A drunken patron insists the keep's curse is growing stronger and tries to start a brawl.
locations.dmInstructions: Cira is the party's best source for rumors and local color. She can direct them to Elder Mirna or Sergeant Feld for more official matters. A DC 10 Persuasion check gets her to share stories about the keep and its past. If trouble starts, Cira expects the party to help keep peace.

doors.name: Inn Door
doors.description: A wide, inviting wooden door painted green, with a brass lantern hanging overhead.

doors.name: Cellar Hatch
doors.description: A sturdy hatch behind the bar, leading to the root cellar.

dcChecks: Persuasion DC 10: Convince Cira to share confidential rumors or grant a favor.
Insight DC 12: Detect if a patron is hiding something about recent ghost sightings.
locations.accessibility: Easily reached from the square, step-free entrance, welcoming to all.

features.name: The Bar
features.description: A polished oak bar lined with lanterns and dangling good luck charms.

features.name: Hearth and Common Room
features.description: A crackling fire and mismatched armchairs make this a favorite gathering spot.

features.name: Guest Rooms
features.description: Modest but clean rooms available for travelers.
